verses.text: \w The|strong="H3068"\w* prayer \w of|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H3068"\w* poor man, \w when|strong="H3068"\w* \w he|strong="H3068"\w* \w was|strong="H3068"\w* anxious, \w and|strong="H3068"\w* poured out \w his|strong="H3068"\w* supplication before \w the|strong="H3068"\w* \w Lord|strong="H3068"\w*.

Hear, \w O|strong="H4970"\w* Lord, \w my|strong="H0935"\w* prayer: \w and|strong="H1980"\w* \w let|strong="H1980"\w* \w my|strong="H0935"\w* cry \w come|strong="H0935"\w* \w to|strong="H0413"\w* thee.

\w Turn|strong="H7896"\w* \w not|strong="H3808"\w* \w away|strong="H5048"\w* thy \w face|strong="H5869"\w* \w from|strong="H5869"\w* \w me|strong="H8130"\w*: \w in|strong="H1697"\w* \w the|strong="H1697"\w* day \w when|strong="H6213"\w* \w I|strong="H1697"\w* am \w in|strong="H1697"\w* trouble, incline thy ear \w to|strong="H1697"\w* \w me|strong="H8130"\w*. \w In|strong="H1697"\w* \w what|strong="H1697"\w* day soever \w I|strong="H1697"\w* \w shall|strong="H3808"\w* call upon thee, hear \w me|strong="H8130"\w* speedily.

\w For|strong="H3045"\w* \w my|strong="H3045"\w* days \w are|strong="H3045"\w* vanished \w like|strong="H3808"\w* smoke: \w and|strong="H3045"\w* \w my|strong="H3045"\w* bones \w are|strong="H3045"\w* grown dry \w like|strong="H3808"\w* fuel \w for|strong="H3045"\w* \w the|strong="H4480"\w* fire.

\w I|strong="H3201"\w* am smitten \w as|strong="H3824"\w* grass, \w and|strong="H5869"\w* \w my|strong="H3808"\w* \w heart|strong="H3824"\w* \w is|strong="H5869"\w* withered: because \w I|strong="H3201"\w* forgot \w to|strong="H3201"\w* eat \w my|strong="H3808"\w* bread.

\w Through|strong="H1980"\w* \w the|strong="H1870"\w* voice \w of|strong="H0776"\w* \w my|strong="H1980"\w* groaning, \w my|strong="H1980"\w* bone hath cleaved \w to|strong="H1980"\w* \w my|strong="H1980"\w* flesh.

\w I|strong="H3808"\w* am become \w like|strong="H3808"\w* \w to|strong="H1696"\w* \w a|strong="H1696"\w* pelican \w of|strong="H1004"\w* \w the|strong="H1696"\w* wilderness: \w I|strong="H3808"\w* am \w like|strong="H3808"\w* \w a|strong="H1696"\w* night raven \w in|strong="H3427"\w* \w the|strong="H1696"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*.

\w I|strong="H0776"\w* \w have|strong="H0776"\w* watched, \w and|strong="H3068"\w* \w am|strong="H3068"\w* become \w as|strong="H3068"\w* \w a|strong="H3772"\w* sparrow \w all|strong="H3605"\w* alone \w on|strong="H0776"\w* \w the|strong="H3605"\w* housetop.
All the day long my enemies reproached me: and they that praised me did swear against me.
For I did eat ashes like bread, and mingled my drink with weeping.
Because of thy anger and indignation: for having lifted me up thou hast thrown me down.
My days have declined like a shadow, and I am withered like grass.
But thou, O Lord, endurest for ever: and thy memorial to all generations.
Thou shalt arise and have mercy on Sion: for it is time to have mercy on it, for the time is come.
For the stones thereof have pleased thy servants: and they shall have pity on the earth thereof.
And the Gentiles shall fear thy name, O Lord, and all the kings of the earth thy glory.
For the Lord hath built up Sion: and he shall be seen in his glory.
He hath had regard to the prayer of the humble: and he hath not despised their petition.
Let these things be written unto another generation: and the people that shall be created shall praise the Lord:
Because he hath looked forth from his high sanctuary: from heaven the Lord hath looked upon the earth.
That he might hear the groans of them that are in fetters: that he might release the children of the slain:
That they may declare the name of the Lord in Sion: and his praise in Jerusalem;
When the people assemble together, and kings, to serve the Lord.
He answered him in the way of his strength: Declare unto me the fewness of my days.
Call me not away in the midst of my days: thy years are unto generation and generation.
In the beginning, O Lord, thou foundedst the earth: and the heavens are the works of thy hands.
They shall perish but thou remainest: and all of them shall grow old like a garment: And as a vesture thou shalt change them, and they shall be changed.
But thou art always the selfsame, and thy years shall not fail.
The children of thy servants shall continue: and their seed shall be directed for ever.
